Headline: Airbus Blames Design Software Incompatibility for Airbus A380 Two Year Delay

Headline: UK Rural Payments Project Delays

Headline: UK MoD Defense Information System £3.1 Billion Over Budget

Headline: Wisconsin's Accountability, Consolidation, and Efficiency IT Project  Major Fiasco

Headline: OMB Halts National Archives and Records Administration’s (NARA) $567 Million Electronic Records Archive (ERA) Project Development
Impact - Raw: The system operates with minimum functionality despite $375 Million spent.

Headline: LA Unified School District Court Mandated Student Educational Tracking System Flops
Impact - Raw: Thousands of students are without course schedules.

Headline: California's $96 million Business Licensing System in Trouble
Impact - Raw: The system went live in 2013, but only 1/3 of the state boards and commissions online as promised. The original estimate was $28 million, but now it's at least $96 million for just 1/2 of the state boards.

Headline: Software bug causes 2004-2005 Toyota Prius to stall
Impact - Raw: 20,000 cars recalled

Headline: Toyota Offers to Fix Gas Pedals and Software to Stop Runaway Cars

Impact - Raw: Batteries were degrading prematurely, affecting 100,000 Civics.

Impact - Raw: The recall hits 2014 Chevrolet Silverado and GMC Sierra models.

Headline: Toyota Recalls 1.9 Million Cars to Fix Software Flaw
Impact - Raw: Toyota software bug in power converter might cause car to slow down and stop unexpectedly.

Headline: Nissan Recalls Nearly 1 Million Cars to Fix Air Bag Control Software
Impact - Raw: The software installed on the vehicles may incorrectly determine that the passenger seat is empty when it is, in fact, occupied.

Headline: Hudson Bay Co. ERP System Problems Contribute to Losses
Impact - Raw: Losses reached $10 Million.

Headline: Levi Strauss Reports 2nd Quarter Profits Hurt by ERP Integration That Stopped Orders for a Week
Impact - Raw: The cost of issue was $47 Million.

Impact - Raw: The estimated cost was $80 million - this is the amount SAP was suing its insurer Swiss Re for to cover the settlement.

Impact - Raw: The original plan was $14 Million and 14-months to develop. Instead, it took $47 Million and 30-months.

Headline: Bridgestone Sues IBM for $600 Million over Failed ERP System
Impact - Raw: IBM says all the problems are Bridgestone's.

Headline: USAF $2.2 Billion Defense Enterprise Accounting Management System Enters Last Phase

Impact - Raw: Numerous flights were delayed.

Headline: United Airlines Finally Abandons the Automated Baggage-handling System at Denver International Airport
Impact - Raw: The cost of the abandoned system was $230 million. Another $70 million was spent on a conventional baggage system that replaced it. And $340 million more was paid in interest. It will cost $9 million over four years to demolish and cart away system the system.

Impact - Raw: There were delays at ports of entry for most of the day.

Headline: UK National Air Traffic Control System Crashes
Impact - Raw: Numerous flights were delayed.

Headline: New AU$250 Million Australian Custom Service Integrated Cargo System Fails
Impact - Raw: Shipping disruptions in Australian ports persisted for over a year.

Impact - Raw: The problem caused flight delays for a few days.

Headline: All Nippon Airways Reservation System Crashes
Impact - Raw: 130 flights were cancelled and 306 flights were delayed, affecting nearly 70,000 passengers.

Impact - Raw: When TRACON has a problem, flights are delayed because they aren't allowed to take off.

Headline: FAA Atlanta Air Traffic Control Center Computer Fails

Headline: United Airlines Flight and Dispatch Goes Down

Impact - Raw: The system was out for 6 hours and 40 minutes. Several flights had to be cancelled and dozens were delayed.

Impact - Raw: Australian flights were delayed.

However, in June 2015, the Massachusetts exchange, which was originally estimated to cost $174 million to develop, was rescoped at a new cost of $281 million. This is likely to ballon to over $300 million.

The original cost in 2007 was $83 Million for a six year project. The state’s own project-related
costs added up to an additional $109 million,brining the total to $227 million. HP was paid $17 million after refunding the state $7 million..

Headline: Software Update Crashes UK RBS Bank Group IT Systems, Millions of Customers Without Access to Accounts
Impact - Raw: System outage also hits banks and their customers across UK.

Headline: Bank Blames GPS Error for Repossessing Wrong House
Impact - Raw: Bank apologizes and offers small compensation for the error. Owner claims $18,000 in lost furnishings.

Headline: UK RBS Bank Group Fined by Financial Conduct Authority £56 Million over 2012 IT Outages
Impact - Raw: RBS already paid out £175 Million in compensation and other costs, and is investing £1 Billion to improve internal IT.

Headline: Dutch Tax Office Accidentally Erases 730,000 Digitally Submitted Tax Returns
Impact - Raw: Taxpayers must resubmit their returns.

Headline: Veterans Affairs Failure to Update Software Shortchanges War Widows for 12 years
Impact - Raw: 400,000 widows are owed money.

Headline: California Unemployment System Programming Issues Delay Checks
Impact - Raw: 117,000 unemployment checks were not sent out.

Headline: UK HMRC Agency Computer System Errors Hit 100,000 Taxpayers
Impact - Raw: The tax agency claimed the system was working as it should.

Headline: UK Government Tries to Quell Firestorm over Incorrectly Computed Taxes for 13.5 Million Taxpayers
Impact - Raw: HMRC computer system modernization to blame.

Headline: Tax Refunds for Over 600,000 H&R Block Users Delayed Because of eFile Problems
Impact - Raw: Refunds were delayed up to 8 weeks.

Headline: Massachusetts Department of Revenue Cancels New $114 Million Tax System Development
Impact - Raw: The state cancels its contract with Deloitte for poor performance after spending $54 Million.

Headline: North Carolina Cancels Tax Computer System Project After Spending $90.8 Million
Impact - Raw: The state will go in another direction.

Headline: UK £2.4 Billion Universal Credit Programme Begins Again
Impact - Raw: The program completion date is pushed from 2015 to 2017. The £425m spent on the program so far is likely to be written off.

Headline: Indiana's Bureau of Motor Vehicles Overcharged 180,000 Customers over Ten Years
Impact - Raw: The state promises to refund $29 Million (plus interest) in wrongly calculated excise tax fees.

Headline: Ontario's New CN$240 Million Social Assistance Management Systems (SAMS) Overpays 17,000 Social Welfare Recipients Some CN$20 Million
Impact - Raw: Government calls the overpayment a glitch.

Headline: South Carolina and HP Agree Over Failed $151 million 2013 Child Support Project
Impact - Raw: HP agrees to pay South Carolina $44 Million, and South Carolina Agrees to Pay HP $5 million, leaving state with $112 million in costs. The state has paid another $66 million in federal fines for not having the system in place.

Headline: Nissan Recalls Nearly 1 Million Cars to Fix Software Flaw
Impact - Raw: Affected models have an airbag deployment software bug.

Headline: California's Court Management System Cancelled
Impact - Raw: The $260 million project to consolidate California's court IT systems was canceled after costs exploded to at least $1.9 billion.

Headline: North Carolina's Medicaid System Delivered, But With Problems
Impact - Raw: NCTracks project grows from $92.7 million to $230 million, and takes two years before it works properly.

Headline: California's $158 million  Disability Insurance Upgrade Project Finally Delivered
Impact - Raw: The project was delivered three years late and $123 million over the total original budget.

Headline: California's Unemployment Call Center Project Delivered Late and Over-budget
Impact - Raw: The project was delivered 4 years late and $43 million over the total original budget.

Headline: California's Unemployment Claims Redesign Project Delivered Late and Over-budget
Impact - Raw: The project was delivered 5 years late and $48 million over-budget. Problems with rollout cost another $4 million to fix.

Headline: Social Security Administration Disability Case Processing System Project Runs On and On
Impact - Raw: The original project was supposed to cost $381 million and to be delivered by 2013, but after $288 million was spent, nothing was delivered. At least another $170 million will be spent to get system running by 2016.

Headline: Navy ERP Systems Finally Completed
Impact - Raw: Systems are 3 years late and $250 million over budget.

Headline: New $162 Million LA County Dept of Water and Power Billing System Was Supposed to Cost $59 Million
Impact - Raw: The DWP system was originally supposed to cost $59 Million.
